Description of incident: An employee's laptop was stolen on September 24.  It contained the information of patients who received prostate services between 1997 and 2008.  The laptop was stolen from an unlocked urology medical office.  No Social Security numbers, full medical records or health insurance identification numbers were on the stolen laptop. Patient names, medical record numbers, dates of birth and treatment information were on the laptop.UPDATE (11/23/10): The breach affected 3,700 patients.
